emails.subject: Team Holiday Calendar
emails.body:
Hi colleagues,

 

I did prepare to explain this in our ITM SE team call yesterday but time did not permit.

 

Attached you find a proposal for an easy approach towards creating and maintaining a team calendar where we can all register our holidays, absences or any event that can be relevant for sharing with all of us.

 

If we agree on this approach, we can open the calendar for our sales and marketing colleagues as well.

 

Please have a look and share me your feedback.  Thanks.

 

Ciao,

Stefan

 

Stefan Brié

Solution Consultant  | (M) +32 498 94 52 81 |  <https://www.linkedin.com/in/stefan-brié-269b731/> 

Micro Focus Belgium | Luchthavenlaan 27, B-1800 Vilvoorde,  Belgium

stefan.brie@microfocus.com <mailto:stefan.brie@microfocus.com>  

 

Planned absence:  May 13th – 20th ,  June 20th – July 5th.

emails.subject: OpenAir Time Reporting Guidance Reminder
emails.body:
Dear all, 

Gentle reminder that when reporting time in OpenAir, as per the current process, the only OpenAir Projects that should be used are:

*	opportunity related projects that are created from SalesForce 
*	“ITM INTL Internal”
*	“ITM INTL LFR Enablement"

A quick guide is available on our INTL SE Portal <https://microfocusinternational.sharepoint.com/sites/sales/Sales-EMEA/INTLPresale/Forms/AllItems.aspx?id=/sites/sales/Sales-EMEA/INTLPresale/Documents/OpenAir/20220216-1-openair-itm-intl-quick-reference.pdf&parent=/sites/sales/Sales-EMEA/INTLPresale/Documents/OpenAir&p=true&ga=1> .
Please do not use other projects that might be available when reporting your time. 

At the same time, time spent in vacation, PTO, Sick Leave, travel is not to be reported. 
In case you receive a warning that the number of hours for a week is less than 40, please proceed with the submission of the timesheet (if everything else is correct). 

Do not hesitate to reach out to me if you have any questions and/or face challenges.  

Best regards,
—A

emails.subject: Nouveaux régimes de frais de santé et prévoyance - Micro Focus
emails.body:
Bonjour à toutes et tous, 

 

Suite aux réunions instants RH présentant les nouveaux régimes de frais de santé et prévoyance, nous vous invitons à trouver ci-joint : 

*	Le support de présentation des garanties frais de santé et prévoyance 
*	Le détails des garanties du régime de frais de santé (+ surcomplémentaire)
*	L’enregistrement audio de la réunion instants RH : ici <https://microfocusinternational-my.sharepoint.com/:v:/g/personal/anais_goldfarb_microfocus_com/EQvns8YW4l1MoWXBge293h8B19EHLX0ib4830g3nXlOlcQ>  

 

Le détails des garanties du régime de prévoyance vous sera envoyé dans les prochains jours. 

 

Pour rappel, les garanties ont automatiquement été mises à jour au 1er juillet 2022.

Les personnes bénéficiant actuellement de l’option de la surcomplémentaire seront automatiquement renouvelées (adhésion visible sur le site de Mercer).

Les personnes souhaitant souscrire à la surcomplémentaire devront envoyer à HRGS leur demande d’adhésion, conformément au calendrier suivant :

*	Avant le 29 juillet pour une affiliation au 1er aout 2022
*	Avant le 31 août pour une affiliation au 1er septembre 2022
*	Avant le 30 septembre pour une affiliation au 1er octobre 2022

 

Nous vous remercions pour votre participation et restons à votre disposition pour toutes questions, 

Cordialement 

Anais Goldfarb

HRGS France

emails.subject: A really annoying problem! What about you ?
emails.body:
Hello Team,

 

With the end of the holidays coming, I want to share with you a really annoying problem that I want to fix !

 

User story : We are lucky to have a customer or a prospect who wants to test one of our products (warning for trolls: SaaS & Blueshift aren’t always the solution). To deploy it, it must download software files (e.g. for OO/RPA : 21.3 GB).

 

Since almost 2 years, with the new SLD portal, we can’t generate a public download link. So today my only solution to give binaries to customer is :

 

*	Create a trial license with our internal portal (5 min)
*	Connect to SLD portal to download files (from 10 min to 3 hours)
*	Upload it on One Drive (for 21.3 GB = 36 hours)
*	Share the link with the customer/prospect

 

It's not about the time it takes or the number of actions I have to take (although I would appreciate it being easier and faster). It's more about the customer/prospect experience and the image it reflects of us. I am convinced that we can do something better, but I don’t know what. What about you ? Do you have or know another solution ? If not, I would really like to be able to raise this point and that someone can solve it. I am ready to participate in this discussion.

 

Thank you in advance for sharing your experience

 

Best regards

 





Sales Engineer  <http://linkedin.com/>   <sip:%20william.marcq@microfocus.com> 

 

Mobile +33 612 808 553

Paris La-Défense - France

emails.subject: RE: A really annoying problem! What about you ?
emails.body:
Hello William,

Maybe you'll feel I'm a troll.

The official process for trial : P&P Trials Guide - v1.9 Final 27-06-22.pdf <https://microfocusinternational.sharepoint.com/sites/sales/Documents/Forms/AllItems.aspx?id=%2Fsites%2Fsales%2FDocuments%2FGTM%2FP%26P%20Trials%20Guide%20%2D%20v1%2E9%20Final%2027%2D06%2D22%2Epdf&parent=%2Fsites%2Fsales%2FDocuments%2FGTM> 
After creating the non-web trial opportunity, the Fulfilment process for On Premise License is as follows:
The customer creates a new SLD account
The Customer receives a Micro Focus fulfilment notification email
The email contains a link to the SLD Portal

For sure at some steps on the process, the customer experience customer migth be a little cumbersome, especially when needed to create accounts on our different websites.
But benefit of non-web trial process, is that they should get access to Support with their official entitlement.

Hope this helps.



Cordialement, 

 

Jean-Matthieu Guérin | Field Presales ADM | +33 6 72 56 40 05 - +33 1 55 70 94 66 | jeanmatthieu.guerin@microfocus.com <mailto:jeanmatthieu.guerin@microfocus.com>

emails.subject: Important----  INTL SE Activity Tracking System - Change to SFDC
emails.body:
Dear All, 

 

As we are in the last Quarter and closing an exciting year, we will continue our process development and improvements toward better ecosystems and procedures. Based on your feedback on My voice survey, we have reviewed one of the processes, and as a result, I would like to inform you that we will switch out activity tracking starting from the 1st of Sep to SFDC ( Salesforce lighting ).

 

This move will help us in many areas, and I can mention a few of them 

1.	Reduce the number of tools that we are using today to ONE 
2.	SFDC will act as the source of truth 
3.	Consolidated views and dashboard via SFDC
4.	Real opportunity tracking with SFDC sales cycle development 
5.	Alignment with other regions ( NA, APJ ) for one big picture view 

 

 

As most of you know how to create an activity, I expect a smoother transition to the SFDC. However, I am attaching a simple presentation that shares how to create an activity and how to add yourself to the opportunity as a member. Your leaders will share with you more details and will be able to answer any questions 

 

As of today, please make sure you close your Aug Timesheet in OpenAir so we can have the records completed. 

 

Regards, 

Mohammed

Subject: New info on UD versus ServiceNow Discovery

 

Recently Cosmin interviewed a PS person who has direct experience with Universal Discovery and ServiceNow Discovery who was willing to talk with us to describe those differences.  There are some significant differentiators that we should know about when talking to our customers about Universal Discovery as compared to ServiceNow.

 

Please review and give us your thoughts.

 

Topic

ServiceNow Discovery

Universal Discovery

Inventory Discovery

1.	No software utilization metrics available
2.	Agent-based scan results are weak and inconsistent.  Field feedback is their agent is failing.  The agent is only capable of basic discovery and not recommended for use for Asset Management collection (instead it is recommended to import SCCM data).
3.	No “scanner” based tool 
4.	ServiceNow does not recommend scanning endpoint devices (recommends using tools like SCCM instead)
5.	No capability for “call-home” which makes it difficult for discovering remote nodes
6.	No method of automating the discovery of new applications (recognition).  Any changes are manually implemented, 1 by 1.

1.	Support for software utilization for Windows applications
2.	Agent-based discovery is mature and provide strong results.
3.	Scanner can be run on remote device using either agent or agentless methods
4.	UD customers can discover and/or scan servers or endpoints equally as well
5.	Full support for “call-home” allowing for discovery of remote nodes in any fashion
6.	SSA provides methods for building your own recognition library.  Full availability of CMS R&D to customize library on behalf of customer

Bandwidth consumed by Discovery

ServiceNow Discovery has much higher impact on network capacity as there is no concept of delta replication of the changes of a scan from the previous scans. ALL of the scanned data is sent over the network with every subsequent scan

Universal Discovery probes have fully implemented a cache methodology so the only discovered content to hit the network is that which has changed from any previous scans.  As a result, UD is very lightweight in its use of the customer’s network bandwidth.

Cost of Discovery

Customer costs are beyond the initial licensing for discovery if they want to add any of the following

*	- Cloud Discovery
*	- Policy and Compliance Management
*	- Addition of custom attributes and CI types
*	- Tag-based discovery

All UD discovery is 1 flat charge for nodes.  Anything additional is no cost.  Cloud services discovery is no coast.  No additional cost for any analytics of discovery data, policy management, cloud discovery, or for customization of the UCMDB class model.

Speed of Discovery

*	Cloud discovery is slow, can take days to complete, and is not accurate.  Complex cloud environments are very difficult to fully discover without the discovery erroring out.

Cloud discovery is relatively fast and can be tweaked to discover only the content you require.  Cloud complexity has no impact to the successful run of UD discovery of cloud.  Discovery results match 100% with the content actually deployed to the cloud

Policy Management

*	“Baseline” policies are available (at additional cost) but they do not have “Topology” policy capability.  Implementing policies is coding work and requires development knowledge

Baseline and Topology policies are available now at no cost.  Implementation of policies is straightforward and fairly simple.

Automated Service Modeling

*	ServiceNow Discovery states it can do ASM but the slightest hiccup will cause it to fail.  The PS person had never seen a successful service model completed in an automated fashion

Universal Discovery states it can do ASM though it struggles as well.  The key point here is “don’t be intimidated by ServiceNow claims of successful ASM”.  They struggle just as much as UD does.

Single Platform

*	While the ServiceNow platform is slick and appears to be one big app, the reality is there are many databases behind the UI that are constantly replicating data back and forth.  An example is ServiceNow Discovery and its AM tool – this requires a lot of maintenance (just like it would with UD and AM)

UD and AMX, and UD and SMAX both utilize a federated integration methodology that eliminates any of the hassle of data replication between systems.  You set it up once (or in the case of SaaS, it’s set up for you), and away you go.

Upgrades

*	Upgrades are forced once customer reaches n-2 level of versions.  NO help provided in making customizations easier when the upgrade takes place.

With the release of CMS 2022.11, customer changes to OOTB configuration will be retained in all cases (except for discovery scripting and changes to OOTB TQLs).  Full documentation of anything not retained after upgrade will allow the customer to be fully aware of the few tweaks they must make to their customizations once the upgrade is complete

Deployment

*	Deployments can take years with many examples of customers just giving up.  POCs are difficult as well.

POC deployments can typically be completed in 1-2 weeks.  Deployments typically require 1-3 months.

 

This is one person’s feedback so it would be good to get corroboration on this info, but I’m also tired of getting beat up by ServiceNow Discovery, so in the absence of data to the contrary I am ok communicating this new information to our customers as needed.

 

Bill Dyck

Principal Product Manager

Universal Discovery and CMDB <https://docs.microfocus.com/itom/ITOM:Configuration_Management_System/Home>

emails.subject: RE: A really annoying problem! What about you ?
emails.body:
Bonjour William,

Navré d'apprendre ton arrêt maladie, j'espère que tu es bien remis.
Oui le process est un peu compliqué, et pose souvent des soucis lors de l'accès au site web. Auquel cas soit il y a un csm qui peut gérer, soit il faut passer par le chat du Support pour résoudre l'accès.

Dockerhub Microfocus : c'est quoi ? On y trouve quoi ? 






Cordialement, 

 

Jean-Matthieu Guérin | Field Presales ADM | +33 6 72 56 40 05 - +33 1 55 70 94 66 | jeanmatthieu.guerin@microfocus.com <mailto:jeanmatthieu.guerin@microfocus.com>  

 


________________________________

De : William Marcq <william.marcq@microfocus.com>
Envoyé : lundi 5 septembre 2022 08:58
À : Jean Matthieu Guerin <JeanMatthieu.Guerin@microfocus.com>
Objet : RE: A really annoying problem! What about you ? 
 

Salut Jean-Matthieu,

 

Je suis désolé, je n’ai pas pu te répondre avant car j’étais au fonds de mon lit depuis une semaine. Merci beaucoup pour ta réponse. Cette procédure m’avait échappée. On est loin de ce que proposent nos concurrents, mais c’est toujours ça 😉

 

Juste pour info, ça fait une semaine qu’on bataille avec les services (en suivant cette procédure) pour qu’ils acceptent de donner accès au Dockerhub Microfocus au client. Enfin bref … en tout cas merci 😊

 

Best regards

 





Sales Engineer  <http://linkedin.com/>   <sip:%20william.marcq@microfocus.com> 

 

Mobile +33 612 808 553

Paris La-Défense - France

 

 

 

 

De : Jean Matthieu Guerin <JeanMatthieu.Guerin@microfocus.com> 
Envoyé : vendredi 26 août 2022 09:02
À : William Marcq <william.marcq@microfocus.com>; DL-INTL-SE-GALLIA-ALL <DL-INTL-SE-GALLIA-ALL@microfocus.com>
Cc : Alain Rouaud <alain.rouaud@microfocus.com>; Mohammed Arafat <mohammed.m-arafat@microfocus.com>
Objet : RE: A really annoying problem! What about you ?

 

Hello William,

 

Maybe you'll feel I'm a troll.

 

The official process for trial : P&P Trials Guide - v1.9 Final 27-06-22.pdf <https://microfocusinternational.sharepoint.com/sites/sales/Documents/Forms/AllItems.aspx?id=%2Fsites%2Fsales%2FDocuments%2FGTM%2FP%26P%20Trials%20Guide%20%2D%20v1%2E9%20Final%2027%2D06%2D22%2Epdf&parent=%2Fsites%2Fsales%2FDocuments%2FGTM> 

After creating the non-web trial opportunity, the Fulfilment process for On Premise License is as follows:

*The customer creates a new SLD account

*The Customer receives a Micro Focus fulfilment notification email

*The email contains a link to the SLD Portal

 

For sure at some steps on the process, the customer experience customer migth be a little cumbersome, especially when needed to create accounts on our different websites.

But benefit of non-web trial process, is that they should get access to Support with their official entitlement.

 

Hope this helps.

 

 

Cordialement, 

 

Jean-Matthieu Guérin | Field Presales ADM | +33 6 72 56 40 05 - +33 1 55 70 94 66 | jeanmatthieu.guerin@microfocus.com <mailto:jeanmatthieu.guerin@microfocus.com>  

 

 

________________________________

De : William Marcq <william.marcq@microfocus.com <mailto:william.marcq@microfocus.com> >
Envoyé : vendredi 26 août 2022 08:36
À : DL-INTL-SE-GALLIA-ALL <DL-INTL-SE-GALLIA-ALL@microfocus.com <mailto:DL-INTL-SE-GALLIA-ALL@microfocus.com> >
Cc : Alain Rouaud <alain.rouaud@microfocus.com <mailto:alain.rouaud@microfocus.com> >; Mohammed Arafat <mohammed.m-arafat@microfocus.com <mailto:mohammed.m-arafat@microfocus.com> >
Objet : A really annoying problem! What about you ? 

 

Hello Team,

 

With the end of the holidays coming, I want to share with you a really annoying problem that I want to fix !

 

User story : We are lucky to have a customer or a prospect who wants to test one of our products (warning for trolls: SaaS & Blueshift aren’t always the solution). To deploy it, it must download software files (e.g. for OO/RPA : 21.3 GB).

 

Since almost 2 years, with the new SLD portal, we can’t generate a public download link. So today my only solution to give binaries to customer is :

 

*	Create a trial license with our internal portal (5 min)
*	Connect to SLD portal to download files (from 10 min to 3 hours)
*	Upload it on One Drive (for 21.3 GB = 36 hours)
*	Share the link with the customer/prospect

 

It's not about the time it takes or the number of actions I have to take (although I would appreciate it being easier and faster). It's more about the customer/prospect experience and the image it reflects of us. I am convinced that we can do something better, but I don’t know what. What about you ? Do you have or know another solution ? If not, I would really like to be able to raise this point and that someone can solve it. I am ready to participate in this discussion.

 

Thank you in advance for sharing your experience

 

Best regards

 





Sales Engineer  <http://linkedin.com/>   <sip:%20william.marcq@microfocus.com> 

 

Mobile +33 612 808 553

Paris La-Défense - France

emails.subject: [FYA] - New Travel Approval Request process
emails.body:
Action required | France & DECH ITOM Sales Engineering

 

Due to measures implemented to better control our spending, the following mandatory travel approval process has been put in place with immediate effect.

 

1.	All business travel which includes flight, train or hotel expenses must be approved prior to booking. Whether in country or cross-country, whether for internal or customer-facing purposes.
2.	Flight tickets require two-level approval from direct manager and L3 Mgr (Mohammed Arafat).
3.	The attached template must be used to obtain approval.
4.	All requests must be sent to the direct manager (me) for approval.
5.	All approvals must be obtained early enough to allow travel-booking in Concur at low cost and within corporate travel booking policies (see Global Travel Policy <https://comms.microfocus.com/api/v1/tracker?cm_session=dd2a0304-4f9c-4704-b300-eb98954bbedf&cs=98bc642b-eed0-4378-8b79-a8fc836c5ced&cm_type=link&cm_link=08ad5178-ca07-419f-b085-6132df8579c0&cm_destination=https://microfocusinternational.sharepoint.com/sites/Travel/Documents/Forms/AllItems.aspx?id=%2Fsites%2FTravel%2FDocuments%2FTravel%20Policy%2FMF%20Global%20Travel%20Policy%2Epdf&parent=%2Fsites%2FTravel%2FDocuments%2FTravel%20Policy&p=true>  for more information). E.g. flights are usually to be booked at least 3 weeks in advance of travel date --> Approval needs be requested about 4 weeks before actual travel date.
6.	In case of an emergency, contact me directly.

 

The attached travel request form contains two sections: Section B is for customer-facing travel (includes events and partners). Section C is for travel for internal purposes.

 

IMPORTANT: For all travel in the upcoming weeks (e.g. German RESET ITOM in BB) which has already been booked I need you to send me the travel approval requests no later than Monday EOB “after the fact”.

 

In case of any questions, please do not hesitate to contact me.

 

Regards,

Robert

Sales Engineering Manager

IT Operations | France, Germany & Switzerland

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Mobile:  +49 162 292 8992 | Mail:  kreher@microfocus.com <mailto:kreher@microfocus.com> 

NIL SATIS NISI OPTIMUM

emails.subject: CSE Micro Focus France SAS :  ASC Thalasso
emails.body:
Bonjour

 

Vous êtes nombreux à nous contacter pour savoir comment retrouver le descriptif de la thalasso. 

Elle était dans le sondage sur le site ASC. J’en profite pour rappeler à ceux qui ne l’ont pas encore fait que vous devez effectuer votre virement bancaire pour valider définitivement votre inscription (voir mail de Laurent envoyé la semaine dernière)

 

Une envie de se détendre et de prendre soin de vous ? Votre équipe ASC MF vous propose une escapade bien être dans un lieu de rêve : Le Grand Hôtel des Thermes de Saint-Malo*****

https://www.thalasso-saintmalo.com/fr/

 

Formule 2 jours/2 nuits pour 2 personnes (réservée à l'employé MF et l'ayant droit déclaré sur le site ASC), en réservation individuelle à dates libres, suivant les disponibilités de l'établissement.

Hébergement en chambre double face à la mer

- pension complète traditionnelle

- 4 soins de thalassothérapie individuels. Programme pré-établi comprenant :

- 1 Enveloppement d'algues

- 1 Bain Jets aux algues ou 1 Douche Sous-Marine

- 1 Modelage sous affusions ou 1 Modelage Corps

- 1 soin d'effusions dynamiques ou 1 Ondorelax

Plus Accès au Parcours Aquatonic, Sauna, Hammam, Salle de Cardio-Training

 

Les ASC MF subventionnent à 90% le prix total du séjour. 10% restent à charge de l'employé 

Pour profiter du séjour, merci de répondre au sondage et de nous faire parvenir votre règlement (modalités communiquées ultérieurement aux personnes intéressées).

La commande de l'ensemble des séjours sera passée la semaine du 5 décembre. Nous vous ferons alors parvenir le code à communiquer pour faire votre réservation (valable un an après la date de commande). Vous contactez directement l'établissement pour réserver votre séjour aux dates de votre choix suivant disponibilité.

Attention, la réservation est nominative.

 

 

Cordialement

Isabelle et l’équipe ASC.

emails.subject: Re: POC Trip Report - St Microelectronics (Rousset) Sas - O-1712093/O-1697102
emails.body:
William,

 

Checking emails with OO is not too difficult. I have used this simple AFL flow before on a PoC to get new email from a specified folder in Gmail:

 



 

Flow properties are like so:

 



 

The way it works is that you will need a message number to retrieve it. If you know the number, it’s smooth sailing. The way I get the message number is to get the message count in a folder (“Demo”). That number is then automatically the message number of the latest message 😊

 

I thought I have something similar in ClousSlang but I cannot find it at the moment. Let me know if you need it, then I will look for it with more passion 😊

 

Good luck!

 

Regards,

ERwin

 

 

Van: William Marcq <william.marcq@microfocus.com>
Datum: maandag, 5 december 2022 om 09:19
Aan: POC EMEA <swpdl.poc_emea@microfocus.com>, POC ITOM OpsB EMEA <swpdl.poc_itom_opsb_emea@microfocus.com>, Daniel Crisan <crisan@microfocus.com>, Florin Muresan-Madar <florin.muresan@microfocus.com>, Marc Bernis <marc.bernis@microfocus.com>, Philippe Richard <prichard@microfocus.com>, Jean-Luc Senior <jean-luc.senior@microfocus.com>, Robert Kreher <kreher@microfocus.com>, Mohammed Arafat <mohammed.m-arafat@microfocus.com>, Ken O'Hagan <kenneth.ohagan@microfocus.com>, Quentin De Sainte Marie <quentin.de-sainte-marie@microfocus.com>
Onderwerp: POC Trip Report - St Microelectronics (Rousset) Sas - O-1712093/O-1697102

Expected Duration: 30

Opportunity Details

Company Name 

St Microelectronics (Rousset) Sas

Opportunity Name

OB/OO - DC & ITOM AIOPS

Opportunity ID

O-1712093/O-1697102

Country/Geography

France

License Value

USD 400.000

Products Already Owned

-

Competition

Unknow

Products being POC’d

RPA & Bridge Suite

Executive Summary

ST Micro has implemented Micro Focus’ Operations Bridge Manager (OBM) solution for enterprise-wide IT systems observability. OBM 2021.10 is installed on-premises in a classic, non-containerized mode.

As a next step towards increased maturity, an AIOps approach is being considered. In that context, ST Micro would like to validate Micro Focus’ AIOps and automation capabilities, supported by the OPTIC platform

Use Cases

01 Installation of Micro Focus Bridge Suite (containerized)  (Done)
02 Installation of Operations Bridge Analytics  (Done)
03 Installation de Operations Orchestration (with RPA capabilities) (Done)
04 OOTB Automated Event Analytics.
05 OOTB Reporting.
06 Guide Troubleshooting, Guided Root Cause Analysis.
07 Anomaly Detection.
08 Custom data injection.
09 Orchestration & Automation - API (WIP)
10 Orchestration & Automation - RPA (WIP)

Agreement

Yes

State:ACTIVE

Daily Status Update

POC State

ACTIVE

Date of Update

05/12/2022

Achievements - Planned vs Actual (daily)

What went well

RPA use-case completed successfully: Ability to check the status of a Windows service on a remote machine and perform actions accordingly. Run it with OB by injecting variables.

What went wrong

- RPA : For use-case we need to check emails in a mailbox and start an RPA activity when specific email comes. I don't know how to check mailbox.
- Some issues to create services on OBA.

Critical Issues

Nothing

Assistance required

Assistance required on RPA (planned with Florin this week).

Next steps

WIP on OB & RPA use-cases.

Previous Day’s Logs

24/11/2022 - status was Green

POC State

ACTIVE

Date of Update

24/11/2022

Achievements - Planned vs Actual (daily)

What went well

- OO platform is running with RPA capability.

What went wrong

- In our architecture, OO Central Component is deploy on Linux. To execute remote operations on Windows target host, we can't use classical OO actions. We have to use WINRM command. It takes some setup and more manual work, but it works.

 

POC Team Members

 

 

 

Name

 

Role

Onsite/Remote

 

William Marcq

Sales Engineer

Remote

 

Quentin de Sainte Marie

Sales Engineer

Remote

 

 

 

 

 

 

					
Instructions

				
This report has to be sent at the end of each day:

		
Buttons have been created to help ease the following, macros need to be enabled for these to work:

	
* Shift current day entry into pervious day log and insert a new day

		
* Generate an email with HTML body and subject line (Win PC Only) 

		
* Create & Copy Subject line for your email  (Legacy - non-Windows or Outlook users)

		
* Copy the content to be pasted in your email (Legacy - non-Windows or Outlook users)

		
‘Daily Status Update’ only contains the update of the current day (what’s new)

		
‘Previous Day’s Logs’ contains the cumulative days. Do not duplicate the table for each day.

		
To help with the visibility in emails, do not adjust the width of the cells.

emails.subject: Re: POC Trip Report - St Microelectronics (Rousset) Sas - O-1712093/O-1697102
emails.body:
Hi William,

 

It sounds like you are making good progress. Well done!

 

You are correct, reading user email messages from OO is a pull mechanism so you will have to schedule that part of the flow. What I did in the past (back in the day that Gmail was accessible though just userid/password instead of the oauth2 system) is to create a separated folder in my mailbox, created some server-side rules to move selected messages to that folder and poll that folder regularly for content with a scheduled flow. Once found and processed, delete the message.

 

I tried to do something similar the other day with my MF outlook (office365) account in CloudSlang but I don’t understand Office365 enough to get it configured properly. The CS Flow to get email needs for instance the input “tenant”. I did not know our MF tenant id.

 

But anyway, yes, you can build those “check-email” flows in CS with web designer.

If you need some assistance with that, let me know.

 

Best regards,

Erwin

 

 

Van: William Marcq <william.marcq@microfocus.com>
Datum: dinsdag, 6 december 2022 om 08:41
Aan: Erwin van Kruining <erwin.van.kruining@microfocus.com>
Onderwerp: RE: POC Trip Report - St Microelectronics (Rousset) Sas - O-1712093/O-1697102

Hello Erwin,

 

Many thanks for your message. Very helpful because I had the wrong approach. I thought there was a kind of trigger system that I didn’t know. But from what I understand from your message is that I have to create flow “get emails” and schedule it every X minutes to check the mailbox and process the result.

 

Many thanks again. But just for you, when can only use Cloudslang with this customer and we have to check an MS 365 mailbox with the graph API so, I’m working on it 😉

 

 

I will share with you the result.

 

Best regards

 

Best regards

 





Sales Engineer  <http://linkedin.com/>   <sip:%20william.marcq@microfocus.com> 

 

Mobile +33 612 808 553

Paris La-Défense - France

 

 

 






 <https://event.webcasts.com/starthere.jsp?ei=1580045&tp_key=076e621075&sti=sig>      <https://www.brighttalk.com/webcast/8743/566964?utm_source=esign> 

________________________________

 

 <https://www.facebook.com/MicroFocus/>  <https://twitter.com/microfocus>   <https://www.linkedin.com/company/micro-focus?trk=company_logo>   <https://www.youtube.com/microfocus> 

 

________________________________

 

 

 

De : Erwin van Kruining <erwin.van.kruining@microfocus.com> 
Envoyé : lundi 5 décembre 2022 09:47
À : William Marcq <william.marcq@microfocus.com>

I thought I have something similar in ClousSlang but I cannot find it at the moment. Let me know if you need it, then I will look for it with more passion 😊

 

Good luck!

 

Regards,

ERwin

emails.subject: Re: POC Trip Report - St Microelectronics (Rousset) Sas - O-1712093/O-1697102
emails.body:
Excellent! Well done William.

 

Yes, I think it’s always good to preserver and share your content with the rest of the world.

Publishing your content on Marketplace is easy: login with your account and click on the Dashboard tab (top middle). Then you get a screen like this:



 

Press the “Add Item” button for adding a new item 😊

 

Mind you, there are R&D Content-people validating your items and content. They want you to adhere some best practices for your CP (for instance, the library path for CS flows should be /Library/io/cloudslang/<your stuff>)

Here’s a page in our documentation on CloudSlang best practices: https://docs.microfocus.com/doc/ESM/SaaS/BestPracticesCS

 

Good luck

 

Regards,

Erwin

 

 

Van: William Marcq <william.marcq@microfocus.com>
Datum: donderdag, 8 december 2022 om 08:35
Aan: Erwin van Kruining <erwin.van.kruining@microfocus.com>
Onderwerp: RE: POC Trip Report - St Microelectronics (Rousset) Sas - O-1712093/O-1697102

Hi Erwin,

 

Just an update. Big progress on these uses-cases. I create lot of stuff for Office 365 with Cloudslang.

 

If I remember correctly, you had created a CP available on Marketplace. How did you push it ? I just find information for externals & partners.

 

I think my work can be useful.

 

Best regards

 





Sales Engineer  <http://linkedin.com/>   <sip:%20william.marcq@microfocus.com> 

 

Mobile +33 612 808 553

Paris La-Défense - France

 

 

 






 <https://event.webcasts.com/starthere.jsp?ei=1580045&tp_key=076e621075&sti=sig>      <https://www.brighttalk.com/webcast/8743/566964?utm_source=esign> 

________________________________

________________________________

 

 

 

De : Erwin van Kruining <erwin.van.kruining@microfocus.com> 
Envoyé : mardi 6 décembre 2022 09:17
À : William Marcq <william.marcq@microfocus.com>
Objet : Re: POC Trip Report - St Microelectronics (Rousset) Sas - O-1712093/O-1697102

 

Hi William,

 

It sounds like you are making good progress. Well done!

 

You are correct, reading user email messages from OO is a pull mechanism so you will have to schedule that part of the flow. What I did in the past (back in the day that Gmail was accessible though just userid/password instead of the oauth2 system) is to create a separated folder in my mailbox, created some server-side rules to move selected messages to that folder and poll that folder regularly for content with a scheduled flow. Once found and processed, delete the message.

 

I tried to do something similar the other day with my MF outlook (office365) account in CloudSlang but I don’t understand Office365 enough to get it configured properly. The CS Flow to get email needs for instance the input “tenant”. I did not know our MF tenant id.

 

But anyway, yes, you can build those “check-email” flows in CS with web designer.

If you need some assistance with that, let me know.

 

Best regards,

Erwin

 

 

Van: William Marcq <william.marcq@microfocus.com <mailto:william.marcq@microfocus.com> >
Datum: dinsdag, 6 december 2022 om 08:41
Aan: Erwin van Kruining <erwin.van.kruining@microfocus.com <mailto:erwin.van.kruining@microfocus.com> >
Onderwerp: RE: POC Trip Report - St Microelectronics (Rousset) Sas - O-1712093/O-1697102

Hello Erwin,

 

Many thanks for your message. Very helpful because I had the wrong approach. I thought there was a kind of trigger system that I didn’t know. But from what I understand from your message is that I have to create flow “get emails” and schedule it every X minutes to check the mailbox and process the result.

 

Many thanks again. But just for you, when can only use Cloudslang with this customer and we have to check an MS 365 mailbox with the graph API so, I’m working on it 😉

 

 

I will share with you the result.

 

Best regards

 

Best regards

 





Sales Engineer  <http://linkedin.com/>   <sip:%20william.marcq@microfocus.com> 

 

Mobile +33 612 808 553

Paris La-Défense - France

 

 

 






 <https://event.webcasts.com/starthere.jsp?ei=1580045&tp_key=076e621075&sti=sig>      <https://www.brighttalk.com/webcast/8743/566964?utm_source=esign> 

________________________________

 

 <https://www.facebook.com/MicroFocus/>  <https://twitter.com/microfocus>   <https://www.linkedin.com/company/micro-focus?trk=company_logo>   <https://www.youtube.com/microfocus> 

 

________________________________

 

 

 

De : Erwin van Kruining <erwin.van.kruining@microfocus.com <mailto:erwin.van.kruining@microfocus.com> > 
Envoyé : lundi 5 décembre 2022 09:47
À : William Marcq <william.marcq@microfocus.com <mailto:william.marcq@microfocus.com> >
Objet : Re: POC Trip Report - St Microelectronics (Rousset) Sas - O-1712093/O-1697102

 

William,

 

Checking emails with OO is not too difficult. I have used this simple AFL flow before on a PoC to get new email from a specified folder in Gmail:

 



 

Flow properties are like so:

 



 

The way it works is that you will need a message number to retrieve it. If you know the number, it’s smooth sailing. The way I get the message number is to get the message count in a folder (“Demo”). That number is then automatically the message number of the latest message 😊

 

I thought I have something similar in ClousSlang but I cannot find it at the moment. Let me know if you need it, then I will look for it with more passion 😊

 

Good luck!

 

Regards,

ERwin

emails.subject: Communication_Avantage en nature vehicule
emails.body:
Version française :

 

Bonjour,

 

Nous souhaitons vous confirmer qu’à compter de janvier 2023 le nouveau montant de l’avantage en nature de votre véhicule (141.65 €) sera appliqué sur vos fiches de paie.

Ce nouveau montant correspond au calcul légal du véhicule que vous conduisez actuellement, soit 30% de la valeur locative ou 9% du prix d’achat remisé du véhicule en incluant la maintenance l’assurance du véhicule.

 

Bien cordialement,

Equipe Paie et RH

 

 

English version :

 

Hello,

 

We would like to confirm that from January 2023 the new amount of the benefit in kind of your vehicle (141.65 €) will be applied on your payslips.

This new amount corresponds to the legal calculation of the vehicle you are currently driving, i.e. 30% of the rental value or 9% of the discounted purchase price of the vehicle, including maintenance and insurance.

 

Best regards,

Payroll and HR Team

emails.subject: ASC : Bon Thalasso
emails.body:
Bonjour et Bonne année !

 

Ci joint le bon à utiliser pour réserver la Thalasso

Dès que la date de venue souhaitée est fixée , il faut contacter les thermes au 02 99 40 75 00 afin d’effectuer la réservation.

 

Les extra, tels que bar, mini bar, boissons, room-service, téléphone, garage, boutique, taxe de séjour (2,20 euros par jour et par personne), et dépenses personnelles sont à régler sur place.

 

Cordialement

 

L’équipe ASC

Subject: HCMX FinOps - Important information from a partner & demo use-case idea

 

Hi folks,

 

I hope you’re doing well. With Stéphane, we had a meeting with a French partner about HCMX FinOps Express. This partner is old on the subject FinOps and has a privileged position in the Finops network in France. During the presentation of our product, they made a comment that I believe is essential to share with you.

 

They tell us that, according to them, our main asset is the presence of CMDB in HCMX in addition to FinOps tools. Because it is the bread point that often comes back from their customers. They find that this capability of conjunction between the Finops and CMDB tools is the point on which we must bet because nobody answers it in our way today.

 

I have a few thoughts. Could we work together to set up a demo / presentation use-case specific to this theme?

emails.subject: TR: Indemnité télétravail à compter du 1er janvier 2023
emails.body:
FYI,

 

Jean-Charles

 

Important : 

*	Mon numéro de téléphone fixe évolue, effectif immédiatement. L’ancien numéro sera définitivement supprimé le 1er mars. Merci de me contacter désormais au +33 1 89 54 45 97
*	My fixed phone number changes, effective immediately. The old number will be permanently decommissionned on March 1st. Thanks to contact me at +33 1 89 54 45 97

 

Jean-Charles Ripault
Chef de Projet | Project Manager
Planned absence: 18-26 Feb incl.
Micro Focus

Lyon - FRANCE

+33 1 89 54 45 97 – Office <-- À privilégier | Preferred
+33 6 72 99 16 91 – Signal / Mobile 
jean-charles.ripault@microfocus.com <mailto:jean-charles.ripault@microfocus.com> 

Chat with me on Teams! <https://teams.microsoft.com/l/chat/0/0?users=jean-charles.ripault@microfocus.com> 

________________________________







 

"Simple, clear purpose and principles give rise to complex, intelligent behavior
Complex rules and regulations give rise to simple, stupid behavior."
"Des buts et des principes simples et clairs engendrent un comportement complexe et intelligent
Des lois et des règles complexes engendrent des comportements simples et stupides"
-- Dee Hock, former CEO of Visa International.

 

De : HRGS France <hrgscenter_france@microfocus.com> 
Envoyé : jeudi 5 janvier 2023 06:57
Objet : Indemnité télétravail à compter du 1er janvier 2023

 

Bonjour, 

 

Vous percevez actuellement une indemnité de télétravail prévue par accord d’entreprise.

 

Nous tenons à vous informer qu’au cours de l’année 2022, un contrôle URSSAF portant sur les années 2019 à 2021 a fait apparaitre des irrégularités dans le traitement social et fiscal de l’indemnité télétravail que nous vous versons, à savoir une portion soumise à cotisations inférieure au règles URSSAF

Sur ces 3 années, le redressement des cotisations patronales et salariales du télétravail s’élève à 129.000 euros pour la société Micro Focus France.

 

La Direction a pris la décision de ne pas faire supporter le rappel des cotisations aux salariés concernés sur les années 2019 à 2022 et de prendre à sa charge l’intégralité de ce redressement.

Il convient dorénavant de nous conformer aux règles URSSAF en continuant à vous verser la même indemnité télétravail prévue par accord décomposée différemment dans son assujettissement social, à savoir : 

 

1.	une allocation forfaitaire télétravail nette de :

*	50 euros maximum par mois (pour 5 jours télétravaillés par semaine),
*	40 euros maximum par mois (pour 4 jours télétravaillés par semaine),
*	30 euros maximum par mois (pour 3 jours télétravaillés par semaine),
*	20 euros maximum par mois (pour 2 jours télétravaillés par semaine),
*	10 euros maximum par mois (pour 1 jour télétravaillé par semaine),

 

2.	une allocation télétravail brute soumise à cotisations :

*	pour la partie dépassant le plafond autorisé par les URSSAF (= allocation forfaitaire nette ci-dessus) et dans la limite de l’indemnité prévue par accord.

 

Ces modifications seront effectives à compter de la paie de janvier 2023.

A titre indicatif, pour un taux de cotisations salariales à 23% et un taux d’imposition à 17%, l’impact sur le net serait environ de :

*	- 4 € pour l’indemnité mensuelle de 30 €
*	+ 18 € pour l’indemnité mensuelle de 60 €
*	- 23 € pour l’indemnité mensuelle de 83,33€
*	- 34 € pour l’indemnité mensuelle de 125 €
*	- 45 € pour l’indemnité mensuelle de 166,67 €
*	- 113 € pour l’indemnité mensuelle de 450 €

 

Pour plus d’information, vous pouvez vous référer à l’accord télétravail que nous avons mis en conformité avec les syndicats et consulter le site des URSSAF <https://www.urssaf.fr/portail/home/employeur/calculer-les-cotisations/les-elements-a-prendre-en-compte/les-frais-professionnels/le-teletravail.html> 

 

Les équipes RH et Paie sont à votre disposition pour tout complément d’information sur le portail HR Direct <https://us2-smax.saas.microfocus.com/saw/ess/categoryPage/559074/offeringSortBy/1/articleSortBy/1/offeringPage/0/articlePage/0?TENANTID=973580388>  et Payroll Direct <https://us2-smax.saas.microfocus.com/saw/ess/categoryPage/966856/offeringSortBy/1/articleSortBy/1/offeringPage/0/articlePage/0?TENANTID=973580388> 

 

Bien à vous, 

 

Cordialement,

L’équipe RH, France 

 

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------



 

Hi,

 

You are currently receiving a telework allowance provided for by Micro Focus France agreement.

 

We would like to inform you that in 2022, a social security audit covering the years 2019 to 2021 has revealed irregularities in the social and fiscal treatment of the telework allowance that we are paying you: the portion subject to contributions is below the social security rules

Over these 3 years, the adjustment of employer and employee contributions for teleworking equal 129,000 euros.

 

Management has decided that affected employees will not bear the contribution adjustment for the years 2019 through 2022. The company will bear the entirety of this adjustment.

 

As a result, we must comply with social security rules by continuing to pay you the same telecommuting allowance provided for in the agreement, broken down differently in terms of social security contributions, as follows:

 

1. a fixed net telework allowance of:

- 50 euros maximum per month (for 5 days teleworked per week),

- 40 euros maximum per month (for 4 days teleworked per week)

- 30 euros maximum per month (for 3 days teleworked per week),

- 20 euros maximum per month (for 2 days teleworked per week),

- 10 euros maximum per month (for 1 day teleworked per week),

 

2. a gross telework allowance subject to contributions:

- for the part exceeding the ceiling authorized by the social security and within the limit of the allowance provided for by agreement.

 

These changes will be effective as of the January 2023 payroll.

As an indication, for an employee contribution rate of 23% and a tax rate of 17%, the impact on the net would be approximately :

- 4 € for the monthly allowance of 30€

+18 € for the monthly allowance of 60 € 

- 23 € for the monthly allowance of 83.33 €

- 34 € for the monthly allowance of 125 €

- 45 € for the monthly allowance of 166.67 € 

- 113 € for the monthly allowance of 450 €

 

For more information, you can refer to the telework agreement that we have put in conformity with the unions and consult URSSAF <https://www.urssaf.fr/portail/home/employeur/calculer-les-cotisations/les-elements-a-prendre-en-compte/les-frais-professionnels/le-teletravail.html>  website

 

The HR and Payroll teams are at your disposal for any further information on HR Direct <https://us2-smax.saas.microfocus.com/saw/ess/categoryPage/559074/offeringSortBy/1/articleSortBy/1/offeringPage/0/articlePage/0?TENANTID=973580388>  & Payroll Direct <https://us2-smax.saas.microfocus.com/saw/ess/categoryPage/966856/offeringSortBy/1/articleSortBy/1/offeringPage/0/articlePage/0?TENANTID=973580388> 

 

Best regards, 

 

HR Team, France 

 

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

emails.subject: FW: Internet refund expense - French Remote work agreement
emails.body:
FYI

 

From: Virgile Ygorra 
Sent: lundi 16 janvier 2023 14:30
To: Robert Kreher <kreher@microfocus.com>
Subject: Internet refund expense - French Remote work agreement

 

Hi Robert,

As discussed, I just launched an expense report to get my internet subscription refunded for 2021 and 2022.

As per the French remote working agreement of 2018 -  https://microfocusinternational.sharepoint.com/teams/RHENTCOFRANCE/SitePages/Home.aspx <https://microfocusinternational.sharepoint.com/teams/RHENTCOFRANCE/SitePages/Home.aspx>  and the newest one from 2022 –  Accord Télétravail 2023.pdf <https://microfocusinternational.sharepoint.com/sites/HR/Comms%20Docs/Accord%20T%C3%A9l%C3%A9travail%202023.pdf> 

 

It is stated that:

 

« 3 – Situation particulière des populations commerciales Tous les employés sont éligibles au télétravail dit « partiel », cependant dans la situation particulière des populations commerciales (vente et avant-vente), un nombre de jours en télétravail ne peut être prédéterminé, ce métier nécessitant déjà une absence importante et régulière du site de rattachement. Le travail à domicile ne peut ainsi être ni régulier ni préétabli. Cependant, et pour des questions d’équité et de flexibilité d’organisation de leur activité, cette catégorie d’employés pourra demander à bénéficier d’une participation aux frais de connexion Internet selon les modalités définies en Annexe. »

 

In Annex, we find that there is a limit of 360€ / year.

 

Regarding the delay of my request, unfortunately this document was never communicated to me since I joined microfocus more than 1,5 year ago, whereas it is stated that the main principles of the remote work agreement should be communicated yearly to French employees.

 

« 9.3. Message annuel. Un message annuel de rappel des grands principes et règles du télétravail au sein de la société sera adressé tous les ans par la direction des ressources humaines à l'ensemble des salariés. »

 

Thank you in advance for your understanding!

Best regards,
Virgile Ygorra

emails.body:
<https://us1-smax.saas.microfocus.com:443/resources/images/logo_itsma.png?TENANTID=775853316> 	Service Management Automation
 

Hi William ,

Welcome to the Demo Center of Excellence… 

You have two options to access the environment:

1. Any time via the Jump host:

*	RDP to 10.16.12.151   - must be on the MF VPN (the Singapore or India end points will provide the best performance)
*	Login name – advantageinc\william.marcq
*	Password – MFS0ftware% <- note a zero and not an O
*	You can find a reference page that contains details of the various ITOM components within the environment by clicking on the "DCoE Links" icon on the desktop or navigate to C:\LaunchPage\ on the jumphost to locate the shortcut; It would be best to copy this shortcut to your desktop too.

2. Directly from your desktop without a VPN.

*	once you submit a demo request through the SMAX Self Service Portal you will be able to access the demo content 15 minutes prior to the requested start time and up to 1 hour after the demo finish time, this is to allow for your demo / customer meeting to run over time and not be cut off from the demo content.
*	a small number of content items may not be accessible directly, the Service Requests will list what cannot be accessed directly.
*	Outside of these times the content will not be available and you will need to access the environment via the jumphost

The showcase Narratives can be found in the SMAX Self Service Portal, https://us1-smax.saas.microfocus.com/saw/ess?TENANTID=775853316 <https://nam12.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fus1-smax.saas.microfocus.com%2Fsaw%2Fess%3FTENANTID%3D775853316&data=05%7C01%7Cwilliam.marcq%40microfocus.com%7Ce2ca2b2b82e94d64e25308dafad9ea47%7C856b813c16e549a585ec6f081e13b527%7C0%7C0%7C638098111092371023%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=K8DP5U3Bl8Kpwp7h5p6UQJxCs9lNExy0ShoY%2BNjzYLs%3D&reserved=0>  -> Showcase / Demo content. 

To log into the Self Service Portal, use your william.marcq login and MFS0ftware% (unless changed) password; **Note: you will be asked for your login twice as part of the authentication process.

When using the environment for demos or to test destructive scenarios please select / submit a request for the appropriate Service Offering in the Self Service Portal that meets the needs of your demo; even if this is via the jumphost. Please check the calendar to ensure no other demos are booked at your required time.

Many of the ITOM Products, OBM, BVD, SMAX and RPA / OO, are connected to Active Directory thus you can use your william.marcq credentials to connect (no domain required).

If you have any issues please send submit a case to the team via https://us1-smax.saas.microfocus.com/saw/ess/offeringPage/28920?TENANTID=775853316 <https://nam12.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fus1-smax.saas.microfocus.com%2Fsaw%2Fess%2FofferingPage%2F28920%3FTENANTID%3D775853316&data=05%7C01%7Cwilliam.marcq%40microfocus.com%7Ce2ca2b2b82e94d64e25308dafad9ea47%7C856b813c16e549a585ec6f081e13b527%7C0%7C0%7C638098111092371023%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=4AhGsIlCqDaENROlMCeMz%2BBqJBDzg%2Bv2lRQ%2Fkh38j3o%3D&reserved=0>  and or a mail to your Practice Leader(s) and we'll help as quickly as possible.

Warm regards,

The Demo Center of Excellence team

 
 
 
Sent automatically from Service Management Automation. Please do not reply directly to this email.

emails.subject: OpenText - Preparation for 31 January
emails.body:
<https://cm-email-assets.s3.amazonaws.com/images/ContactMonkey-User-j6KS3MfFW5zWMkUuVzWbkEjwOaItc3oYgLoDo9nnHmvzE0vYZyaytw3KIV4LwSJHIFlvawnZCCPy0y5cZrf5jPOBtP1iNbeGdltBwip5A2chdeDmBLrdWkpmL41NdABh/Micro%20Focus%20Logos/mf_logo_white_100px.png> 

24 January 2023


OpenText - Preparation for 31 January


We are fast approaching our Day 1 as OpenText employees on 31 January. Ahead of this we want to make you aware of important information and action points to enable a smooth transition.

 	 

Key Events

Mark Barrenechea, OpenText’s CEO’s Town Hall 

You will receive an invite to our first virtual town hall with OpenText’s CEO Mark Barrenechea. The call will be held on 31 January at 8am EST. To access this call, you will need to enter the password provided. A recording of this call will be made available shortly after its completion.

 

ELT Town Hall events

On 31 January you will also be invited by your ELT member to an OpenText functional town hall meeting. These will be held between 10am and 1pm EST so please look out for these. The calls will be recorded.

 

Face to Face Events at Micro Focus offices

Over the course of the next few months, we are planning welcome events for specific office locations across the globe. Look out for the invites for your location and please make every effort to attend.

 

 	 

Where to find more information  

From Day 1 there will be a wealth of communication about the acquisition, including a comprehensive FAQ on InFocus <https://nam12.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fcomms.microfocus.com%2Fapi%2Fv1%2Ftracker%3Fcm_session%3D7d7568fd-e23c-43b0-9722-58da0632c662%26cs%3Dfe90395b-ff30-4fad-81dd-c0a9c7b1f818%26cm_type%3Dlink%26cm_link%3Dfe69f797-516f-467f-92b0-dd2c01478f36%26cm_destination%3Dhttps%3A%2F%2Fmicrofocusinternational.sharepoint.com%2Fsites%2FInFocus%2FPages%2Fenabling-transformation.aspx&data=05%7C01%7Cwilliam.marcq%40microfocus.com%7C5b406e7dab0545586a5f08dafe1dbdee%7C856b813c16e549a585ec6f081e13b527%7C0%7C0%7C638101700933358961%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=mgupnyBxXpd%2BYs8GMbR63KzLgHfRbYDWlpdoYKo1NVo%3D&reserved=0> . This information will be kept up to date. InFocus will mirror the acquisition information on OpenText’s intranet.  Also on Day 1, you will be able to access the online organisation chart to find OpenText leaders. 

 

As an easy place to go for any questions, you will be able to submit any integration questions to ask@opentext.com <mailto:ask@opentext.com> . Look out for more details on this within the Day 1 communication.

 

Communicating with our customers, partners and suppliers  

We will communicate with our customers, partners and suppliers that we are now part of OpenText on 31 January and 1 February (the emails are being sent in batches). There will be a dedicated InFocus page for our customer facing employees to find information and useful resources to share with customers.

 

Sales targets, assignments and compensations 

For the Sales organisation all the communicated FY23 targets, assignments and compensation structures remain in place until further notice, even if you have not yet received a sales letter.

 

Branding and social media  

We all play a role in reinforcing the company brand, and from Day 1 we will transition to using the OpenText logo. There will be new email signatures and a social media profile pack to download and use going forward. In addition, Micro Focus’ websites and social media profiles will be updated for Day 1. 

 

 	 

OpenText IT on-boarding

OpenText Credentials and Email
From Day 1 all Micro Focus employees will have an OpenText email address. Messages sent to this address will be auto-forwarded to your Micro Focus mailbox. 
Until further integration activities commence, you will continue to send all emails from your Micro Focus mailbox, but you will be able to receive emails sent to both addresses. 


Initially employees will receive two emails regarding the activation of their OpenText credentials:

1.	An invitation from OpenText Core – a file sharing solution. Please do not register with this service until you have completed your OpenText IT On-boarding, as you will need to register with your OpenText credentials. (see point 2)
2.	Your OpenText IT On-boarding instruction email - which will contain your new OpenText email address and password.

Please note that the allocation of contingent workers email credentials will follow shortly after Day 1. 

 

Pulse Secure and Two Factor Authentication (2FA)
In preparation for the IT on-boarding process, it is critical that you are able to connect to Micro Focus Pulse Secure VPN. This will be required for enrolling in OpenText's Two Factor Authentication service, which uses Symantec VIP.


Therefore, we ask that you all connect to Micro Focus Pulse Secure once this week, for at least 15 minutes. This will help identify if anyone has any connection issues that can be resolved prior to Day 1.


If you already have Pulse Secure installed on your device, simply connect to your usual regional connection.


If you DO NOT have Pulse Secure installed on your device then you will need to download the Pulse Secure VPN client, instructions for which can be found on InFocus. <https://nam12.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fcomms.microfocus.com%2Fapi%2Fv1%2Ftracker%3Fcm_session%3D7d7568fd-e23c-43b0-9722-58da0632c662%26cs%3Dfe90395b-ff30-4fad-81dd-c0a9c7b1f818%26cm_type%3Dlink%26cm_link%3Dc0fa4e29-956b-447b-99b9-f32f822f1e8e%26cm_destination%3Dhttps%3A%2F%2Fmicrofocusinternational.sharepoint.com%2Fsites%2FIT%2FPages%2Fapplication-access.aspx%3Ftab%3DVPN&data=05%7C01%7Cwilliam.marcq%40microfocus.com%7C5b406e7dab0545586a5f08dafe1dbdee%7C856b813c16e549a585ec6f081e13b527%7C0%7C0%7C638101700933515202%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=LXUkjIF8pMhps6dMq7HYBa%2BkcAOb85Qxp2UTR85jADw%3D&reserved=0> 


Connecting to Pulse Secure will also require Micro Focus’ Two Factor Authentication (2FA), instructions for which can be found here.  <https://nam12.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fcomms.microfocus.com%2Fapi%2Fv1%2Ftracker%3Fcm_session%3D7d7568fd-e23c-43b0-9722-58da0632c662%26cs%3Dfe90395b-ff30-4fad-81dd-c0a9c7b1f818%26cm_type%3Dlink%26cm_link%3Dc45b32a9-b8e9-49d3-a81d-224e3cbbde2d%26cm_destination%3Dhttps%3A%2F%2Fmicrofocusinternational.sharepoint.com%2Fsites%2FIT%2FPages%2F2FA.aspx&data=05%7C01%7Cwilliam.marcq%40microfocus.com%7C5b406e7dab0545586a5f08dafe1dbdee%7C856b813c16e549a585ec6f081e13b527%7C0%7C0%7C638101700933515202%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=RkbcsM%2B%2FMP90psjRdNEFnQfcdfsmEwq4S3Xp8Hmy3wI%3D&reserved=0> 

 

 	 

Important reminders

Chart of Approvals

From 31 January there will be changes to the Chart of Approvals <https://nam12.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fcomms.microfocus.com%2Fapi%2Fv1%2Ftracker%3Fcm_session%3D7d7568fd-e23c-43b0-9722-58da0632c662%26cs%3Dfe90395b-ff30-4fad-81dd-c0a9c7b1f818%26cm_type%3Dlink%26cm_link%3De38a637b-209a-4fc0-ad33-7c6d3fce262c%26cm_destination%3Dhttps%3A%2F%2Fmicrofocusinternational.sharepoint.com%2Fsites%2FFinance%2FPages%2Fchart-of-approvals.aspx&data=05%7C01%7Cwilliam.marcq%40microfocus.com%7C5b406e7dab0545586a5f08dafe1dbdee%7C856b813c16e549a585ec6f081e13b527%7C0%7C0%7C638101700933515202%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=tm28sACuROzsbWzUnaTujh70oyOkHQTifSncG%2BBaxTU%3D&reserved=0> , these will include changes to finance, procurement, GTM and HR. These changes will be interim while we integrate the two organisations. Take the time to review it and understand how it impacts your role.  

 

Micro Focus Share Plans

You may have received emails regarding your share plans from either shareplans@microfocus.com <mailto:shareplans@microfocus.com>  or equateplus. Please ensure that you have reviewed these emails and taken any action required. The FAQ on InFocus <https://nam12.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fcomms.microfocus.com%2Fapi%2Fv1%2Ftracker%3Fcm_session%3D7d7568fd-e23c-43b0-9722-58da0632c662%26cs%3Dfe90395b-ff30-4fad-81dd-c0a9c7b1f818%26cm_type%3Dlink%26cm_link%3Dcf3d7d74-50b3-468b-b990-59a26a6cd06d%26cm_destination%3Dhttps%3A%2F%2Fmicrofocusinternational.sharepoint.com%2Fsites%2FInFocus%2FPages%2Fenabling-transformation.aspx&data=05%7C01%7Cwilliam.marcq%40microfocus.com%7C5b406e7dab0545586a5f08dafe1dbdee%7C856b813c16e549a585ec6f081e13b527%7C0%7C0%7C638101700933515202%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=8RfqcHlF8ov0xNnpJ7e2vZ2SaQIZmLxe%2B1gNGR26ObY%3D&reserved=0>  has been updated to reflect the latest information on share plans. 

 

 	 

We will continue to share with you the information you need as soon as it is available from OpenText. Please ensure you read all communications carefully and action any instructions.

 

Many thanks

 

Communications Team

 

 <https://cm-email-assets.s3.amazonaws.com/images/ContactMonkey-User-j6KS3MfFW5zWMkUuVzWbkEjwOaItc3oYgLoDo9nnHmvzE0vYZyaytw3KIV4LwSJHIFlvawnZCCPy0y5cZrf5jPOBtP1iNbeGdltBwip5A2chdeDmBLrdWkpmL41NdABh/Micro%20Focus%20Logos/mf_logo_grey_100px.png> 

Confidential—Internal Use Only | © 2023 Micro Focus.

 <https://comms.microfocus.com/api/v1/tracker?cm_session=7d7568fd-e23c-43b0-9722-58da0632c662&cm_type=open&cm_user_email=samantha.roussouliere-rodger@microfocus.com&cs=fe90395b-ff30-4fad-81dd-c0a9c7b1f818>

emails.subject: Congratulations! You've been recognised!
emails.body:
<https://microfocus.performnet.com/microfocus/assets/skins/microfocusdm/img/email_logo01.jpg> 	



Congratulations William Marcq!


You have been recognized in the Employee-to-Employee FY23 programme by your colleague Virgile Ygorra in the category of Being an expert.

 	  	  	 
Here is what Virgile Ygorra said about you:	 
William, thank you for your consistent help and support, you are really a great asset to the team and the broad technical background you have is very useful!

 	 

You have earned the following badge(s): 

 <https://microfocus.performnet.com/microfocus//assets/client/Badge/experts_288.png> 	
Being an expert	


 <https://api.biw.cloud/v1/images/size/432/432/1583441374636____highfive_en_US.jpg> 



We celebrate success no matter where we work across the globe. Our passion and our commitment are what make us experts in technology and trusted partners for our customers. Thank you for actively living our values. 



A copy of this email has been sent to your Manager.


Reference # 3154654798 
	
	Please do not reply. This email was sent from a notification-only address.

emails.subject: OpenText completes the purchase of Micro Focus
emails.body:
*** Internal Use – OpenText Confidential ***

 

Dear Colleagues, 

 

OpenText has completed the purchase of Micro Focus.  

 

Today is an important day, a day to celebrate, a day to embrace new opportunities and new colleagues, and a day to reflect on how important our company is and how our customers rely on us. 

 

The most trusted companies trust OpenText.  

 

We are a top 10 global software company and number one in Information Management.  As businesses continue to evolve, it is an exciting time to be in technology.  We are shaping the future and powering customers to re-invent through information and automation.  But most importantly, OpenText is a growth company – we are here to move markets and help our customers win.

 

United we thrive.

 

To my new colleagues from Micro Focus, welcome to OpenText.  You are here today because you are incredibly talented people. You build winning products, you are customer centric, and together, we will fulfill an even larger ambition.  You are now home.  We are going to invest in our company, our people, our products – to grow and to win.  

 

What you will find at OpenText is that we’re innovators. One either makes or consumes, and at OpenText, we are here to bring the future forward through what we build.  We make software that improves mission critical work across all industries.  We are also an impact company – we stand for what we believe in, and we don’t back down.  Diversity and inclusion are essential to innovation, and we approach the world aiming to be deserving of trust.    

 

Organized to accelerate growth, innovation, impact.

 

As an organization, we are laser focused on connecting our solutions to our customers.  We have built an organizational structure and leadership team to support this, and today we welcome our Micro Focus colleagues. 

 

•              Muhi Majzoub – Chief Product Officer, will be responsible for all products, engineering and cloud operations.  Scott Richards, Neil Fowler, Vikas Mathur, Tal Levi-Joseph, Baha Masoud and their respective engineering and product management teams will join Muhi’s team. 

 

•              Ted Harrison – EVP for Enterprise Sales, will focus on our largest accounts and markets in North America and Western Europe.  Gonzalo Usandizaga, Stuart McGill, Pedro Soldado, Tom Ament, and Mark Fazio and their respective sales teams will join Ted’s team.   

 

•              James McGourlay – EVP for International Sales, will focus on sales in Japan, APAC, Africa, Middle East, Eastern Europe and Latin America.  Stephen McNulty and his team will join James’ team.  

 

•              Prentiss Donohue – EVP for Cybersecurity Sales, will focus on a dedicated go-to-market sales organization for Enterprise, SMB, and Consumer.  Matt Mariott, Eric Laursen, Tony Dunn, Steve Starvridis, and Paul Balkwell will join Prentiss’ team.  

 

•              Kristina Lengyel – EVP Corporate Sales, will focus on covering our 100,000 plus corporate accounts, partners and alliances, US Public Sector, and our portfolio group.  Ron Greer and David Valentine will join Kristina’s team. 

 

•              Paul Duggan – Chief Customer Officer, will lead the combined group of Renewals, Professional Services and Customer Support.  Chris Livesey and the renewals team will join Paul’s team.  

 

•              Sandy Ono – Chief Marketing Officer, will lead all brand and demand for OpenText worldwide.  Micro Focus corporate marketing under Eric Varness, internal communications, Vertica marketing, CyberRes marketing, and all product marketing teams will join Sandy’s team. 

 

•              Madhu Ranganathan – Chief Financial Officer, will lead all aspects of finance and digital business services to maximize value for the company.  Michael Kenney, Chris Musker, Neil Franklin and their teams will join Madhu’s team. 

 

•              Renee McKenzie – Chief Information Officer, will be responsible for all aspects of our IT application and infrastructure landscape.  The CIO organization continues to report into the CFO organization.  Robert Jamieson and the Micro Focus CIO organization, along with Chris Bernard and the data office will join Renee’s team.   

 

•              Doug Parker – EVP Corporate Development, will focus on growth through acquisitions and the integration of Micro Focus.  Respective teams will integrate.  

 

•              Tony Kong – SVP Corporate Strategy, will work with me and our business leaders to shape our industrial and product strategies and our annual strategic plan.  Tony will continue to report to Doug.    

 

•              Paul Rodgers – EVP Sales Operations, will focus on deploying world class practices on forecasting, deal operations, sales coverage, and more in support of all the revenue teams.  Mike Steinmetz continues to report into Paul and Dave Yoffie’s organization will join Paul’s team.   

 

•              Michael Acedo – Chief Legal Officer and Corporate Secretary, will focus on all aspects of Legal, Corporate Citizenship, and Government Affairs.  Jessica Vander Ploeg and Kate Tyers will directly join Michael’s team, and the respective Micro Focus Legal and CoSec functions will be integrated into Michael’s team.  

 

•              Brian Sweeney – Chief Human Resources Officer, will focus on all aspects of talent, organization effectiveness, total rewards, DE&I, and wellness.  The respective Micro Focus HR functions will be integrated into Brian’s team.  

 

Business unit and operating excellence

 

We are organized one of two ways: by function or by business unit.

 

By function, we have world class teams and leaders for Strategy, Marketing, Customer Success (including tech support, renewals, professional services), Sales Operations, Finance, IT, HR, Corporate Development and Legal.  These teams support the entire company and are foundational to success.

 

When it comes to go-to-market, we organize by Business Units where we plan to aggressively pursue a total addressable market of over $200B.  Engineering and Sales leadership align on products, markets, and winning strategies. We will spend lots of time here in the coming months and quarters ahead.

 

The following table summarizes our current Business Units and Business Unit Leaders:

 

Business Unit

Engineering Leader

Sales Leader 

Content

John Radko

Kevin Painter

Experience

John Radko

Jason Smith

Business Network

John Radko

Howard Dratler

Digital Business Operations (ITOM)

Vikas Mathur 

Gonzalo Usandizaga

Application Delivery Management (ADM)

Tal Levi-Joseph

Tom Ament

Application Modernization Connectivity (AMC)

Neil Fowler

Stuart McGill

Analytics & AI & Legal Tech

Scott Richards

Serge Savchenko

Portfolio

Scott Richards

David Valentine

Cyber Security Enterprise

Baha Masoud

Matt Marriott 

Cyber Security SMB

Dena Bauckman

Steve Irons (acting)

Cyber Security Consumer

Dena Bauckman

Paul Oetjens

 

The transformative power of information and digitalization. 

 

2023 will be a transformative year.  We have a clear North Star business strategy.  Our charter is for every business to grow faster than GDP and we will accelerate to the cloud with a global structure that scales.  

 

Today is Day 1.  

 

United we thrive, and I am pleased to present our new global campaign: Smarter with OpenText <https://nam12.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.opentext.com%2Fsmarter-with-opentext&data=05%7C01%7Cwilliam.marcq%40microfocus.com%7Cd98779d1f0df4b0d9a1608db037f93da%7C856b813c16e549a585ec6f081e13b527%7C0%7C0%7C638107618747506270%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=iuC5kNI6wY2p9ZE44BoH3%2BkLBvX2karY10wpps2TmCI%3D&reserved=0> .  Bringing our full force to life for customers and partners is the first step to capturing our growth opportunity.  Read more in my Day 1 blog <https://nam12.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fblogs.opentext.com%2Fopentext-welcomes-micro-focus&data=05%7C01%7Cwilliam.marcq%40microfocus.com%7Cd98779d1f0df4b0d9a1608db037f93da%7C856b813c16e549a585ec6f081e13b527%7C0%7C0%7C638107618747506270%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=CoH8EbTsfNRdBMuEZrNNu3lzGTuLDZOxStpqWFx8%2BCo%3D&reserved=0>  about how we will help customers accelerate their digital transformation and learn more about the marketing campaign here <https://nam12.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fblogs.opentext.com%2Fmake-information-your-superpower%2F&data=05%7C01%7Cwilliam.marcq%40microfocus.com%7Cd98779d1f0df4b0d9a1608db037f93da%7C856b813c16e549a585ec6f081e13b527%7C0%7C0%7C638107618747506270%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=17BUPVRRfeLUSUAjGmIu7yZb5RuuSzA%2Ffj7sP%2Fen%2Bxc%3D&reserved=0> .      

 

 <https://nam12.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.opentext.com%2Fsmarter-with-opentext&data=05%7C01%7Cwilliam.marcq%40microfocus.com%7Cd98779d1f0df4b0d9a1608db037f93da%7C856b813c16e549a585ec6f081e13b527%7C0%7C0%7C638107618747506270%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=iuC5kNI6wY2p9ZE44BoH3%2BkLBvX2karY10wpps2TmCI%3D&reserved=0> 

 

For those who are joining us today, I am excited you are on this journey with us.  Let me encourage you to bring the best of yourself and explore everything to its full potential.  

 

Together, we are going to do incredible things. 

 

Please join us for an important All-Employee Town Hall <https://nam12.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fcentral.opentext.com%2Fwelcome-micro-focus%2Felt-town-hall-schedule%2F&data=05%7C01%7Cwilliam.marcq%40microfocus.com%7Cd98779d1f0df4b0d9a1608db037f93da%7C856b813c16e549a585ec6f081e13b527%7C0%7C0%7C638107618747506270%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=ASP5Qqe2AvpMOM8t5J26DrhehkJ28emFMGy7E9M5WPs%3D&reserved=0>  @ 8:00am EST.  Visit OpenText Central <https://nam12.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fcentral.opentext.com%2Fwelcome-micro-focus%2F&data=05%7C01%7Cwilliam.marcq%40microfocus.com%7Cd98779d1f0df4b0d9a1608db037f93da%7C856b813c16e549a585ec6f081e13b527%7C0%7C0%7C638107618747506270%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=Na%2B4wZp7ggof0KszoLEcZjCUFOk8H3d%2B%2BsOqE%2B6kT9Y%3D&reserved=0>  for relevant resources.  

 

Welcome to OpenText. 

 

#GO OPENTEXT

 

Mark

 

Mark J. Barrenechea

OpenText CEO & CTO

 

 <https://nam12.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.opentext.com%2F&data=05%7C01%7Cwilliam.marcq%40microfocus.com%7Cd98779d1f0df4b0d9a1608db037f93da%7C856b813c16e549a585ec6f081e13b527%7C0%7C0%7C638107618747506270%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=ZmMVgajpeBQjzH%2FMxPhAGGgKK2XzKGSrNv3QDksVEKM%3D&reserved=0> 

 

 <https://nam12.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.opentext.com%2Fresources%2Fversant&data=05%7C01%7Cwilliam.marcq%40microfocus.com%7Cd98779d1f0df4b0d9a1608db037f93da%7C856b813c16e549a585ec6f081e13b527%7C0%7C0%7C638107618747506270%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=JX5gbHnyM2rj%2BdNVsjPuPMl36yfzauM0hCozcukQN78%3D&reserved=0>
